transcripts.text: Because I've been under severe attack, the thing that I've noticed is that what exercises the prefrontal cortex is music.  Music is one of the best things you can do to strengthen your brain.  And actually people have known, they've noticed that people don't get Alzheimer's if their either singing or dancing, it strengthens their brain, which is nice to know.  And of course, when I was nearly dead, I forgot all of my ability to read music.  I had to start from scratch.  It was really very disconcerting.  But the thing about the brain is the brain is were able to make new connections.  And so it sort of felt like I was losing my filing system for music, and I had to learn how to do that.  And one of the things that was helping me was if I was playing with a metronome, something about.
